Search network by taxa using keyword, tsn, eol, bold or ncbi IDs.

Source: R/search_taxa.R
search_taxa.Rd

Search network by taxa using keyword, tsn, eol, bold or ncbi IDs.

search_taxa(query = NULL, original = FALSE, verbose = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

query

character specific taxon / keyword / or tsn, eol (page ID), bold & ncbi IDs (mandatory arg).
original

a logical. Should query taxa names from the original publication? (see details section, default is set to FALSE)
verbose

a logical. Should extra information be reported on progress?
...

further arguments to be passed to rmangal::get_gen().

Value

An object of class mgSearchTaxa, which is a data.frame object with all taxa matching the query. All networks in which taxa are involved are also attached to the data.frame.

Details

By default, you are querying taxa based on a homogenized taxonomy (corrected names from TNRS and/or GNR. These taxa might not be the taxon name used in the original publication. In order to query, the original name, set argument original to TRUE.

Examples

search_taxa("Acer")
#> Found 5 taxa
#> Warning: corrupt data frame: columns will be truncated or padded with NAs
#>     id              name   ncbi    tsn     eol   bold    gbif
#> 1    2      Acer negundo   4023  28749  583069 100987 3189866
#> 2    3  Acer saccharinum  75745  28757  583072 101028 3189837
#> 3 3117 Acer shirasawanum  66216     NA 5613162 485602 7263086
#> 4 3144     Acer caudatum 290844     NA 2888949 102168 7263099
#> 5 3151    Acer japonicum  47966 837855 2888970 448667 8010851

#> 4 1    19 robe… 1899… Insects ob… TRUE   FALSE            2019-02-2… 2019-02-2…
#> 5 2    19 robe… 1899… Insects ob… TRUE   FALSE            2019-02-2… 2019-02-2…
# Retrieve higher classification
tsn_acer <- search_taxa("Acer")$tsn
#> Found 5 taxa
taxize::classification(tsn_acer, db = "itis")
